revised_title: The Chemistry of Interstellar Medium and Its Implications for the Solar System's Origin
tldr: The authors discuss the advancements in understanding the chemistry of the interstellar medium, which has provided insights into the formation of stars and the origin of the Solar System. They highlight the discovery of carbon-based molecules and their relation to interstellar grains, as well as the impact of molecular measurements on our understanding of the structure and dynamics of our Galaxy.
